title: General

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is in the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the User will see the Message Inbox button located at the bottom menu tab of the app

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user goes to inbox
and the user has no messages
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see a message icon and below it will say 'No Messages'

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has unread messages in their message inbox
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a red badge to the right of the inbox icon
and there will be a numberical value indicating how many unread messages are in the user's message inbox

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has 1 unread messages in their message inbox
and the user opens message inbox
and the user taps on the unread message
and the user taps back to go back to inbox
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the message badge value will decrease by one 
and the numerical value will disappear from the button indicating if there are no unread messages left

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user accesses message inbox
and the user has a message(s) in inbox
and the user swipes to the left on one of the messages
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see a delete button appear
and tapping on that delete button will delete the message

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user opens a message from Inbox to go to the message details view
and the user taps on the delete button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will receive a dialog box asking user if he wants to delete the message
and tapping on the ok button will delete the message

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user searches for a specific message in inbox
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the message list will refresh and display the messages relevant to the search term that the user had entered

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN messageInboxKillSwitch is set to true in the app config
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Inbox button will be removed from the app

*kill the app and relaunch to get the app config updated.

title: Message types and actions
custom_preconds:
The following test cases will check to see if all the message types are displaying in message inbox
the message types include: 

Push notifications(team specific and general)
promo beacons, check-in offers
POI visit confirmation
native ticket purchase confirmation
received forward ticket confirmation
app updates
forwarded ticket accepted confirmation

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user receives a notification from a promo beacon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see a new message in their message inbox for that promo
and the message will have a blue indicator meaning that it is unread

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has unread messages in their inbox(promo beacon, ballpark inbox message, ticket purchase confirmation, ticket accept message types)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN there will be a badge to the right of the message inbox icon
and the badge will have a numerical value
and that value will be the number of unread messages currently in Inbox

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user reads a message(promo beacon, ballpark inbox message, ticket purchase confirmation message types)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the number displaying in the badge will decrease by 1

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a use receives a new message(promo beacon, ballpark inbox message, ticket purchase confirmation message types)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the number displaying in the badge will increase by 1

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user receives a notification from a promo beacon
and the user opens that message from inbox
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN message inbox will mark the promo beacon message as read and remove the blue indicator

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user receives a promo beacon message
and the message has a URL included
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the promo beacon message will have a 'view details' button in the message details page
and tapping on the view details button will open the url for that promo
AND tapping close on the webview will take the user back to the message

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has checked into a game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see a new message in their message inbox for the check in confirmation
and the message will be marked as unread 
and there will be a blue indicator next to the message

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user sees a checked in message in inbox index
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see the checked in placeholder image appear on the left side of the message cell
and the title will say 'Checked in at <ballpark name>
and below the title will be the users season and overall checkin stats at that ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has checked into a game
and the user has a checkin confirmation message in inbox
and the user taps on that message
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the message details for that check in
and there will be game details available in the message
and below the game details will be your season and total checkin stats
and there will be an image of the ballpark that the user has checked into
and at the bottom of the page will be a View Details button

*Check in for both regular and non-events

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the view details button in the check in message details view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the checkin confirmation page
and on the page will display the name of the Ballpark
and under the ballpark name will be the user's season checkin and overall checkin totals
and below that will be the game matchup
and tapping back button will take you back to the checkin message details view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has checked into a game
and the user received an offer after checking in
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see a new message in inbox for that check in offer
and the message will be marked as unread

NOT FOR 5.0 RELEASE

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has completed a native ticket purchase
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will receive a message in inbox for that purchase
and the message will be marked as unread
and there will be a blue indicator next to the message

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has completed a native ticket purchase
and the user taps on the message for that purchase in inbox
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the message will be marked as read
and the blue indicator will get removed

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user views a ticket confirmation message in inbox index
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see a ticket placeholder image
and the title of the message will be 'Ticket Purchase Confirmation'
and there will be a Order # displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user opens a ticket purchase confirmation message
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the details view of the ticket purchase confirmation message user will see order number, confirmation email address, game details including teams, team logos, date, time, and ballpark name
and below there will be the view tickets button

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user opens a ticket purchase confirmation message
and the user taps on the view tickets button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be taken to the ticket list view of the event

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has accepted a ticket forward
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will receive a ticket accept message in inbox

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user views a ticket accepted message in inbox index
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the message will have a ticket placeholder image
and the title will be Ticket Accepted
And the body will say 'You have accepted x ticket or tickets from <sender's email address>

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user views a ticket accepted message
custom_steps_separated.expected:
hen the user will be taken to the details view of the ticket purchase confirmation message
and the user will see a ticket placeholder image at top
and next to the placeholder image will be the title Ticket Purchase Confirmation
and below it will be an image of the team the ticket was accepted for
and below the image will be game details including teams, team logos, date, time, and ballpark name
and below the game details will the body which will say 'You have accepted x ticket or tickets from <sender's email address>
and below the body will be the view event button

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the view event button from the ticket accepted message
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the ticket event details page of that game
and the user will see the ticket or tickets he has for that game

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user searches for a message using the search bar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the search results will appear in the search view
and tapping on the result will open that message

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a ballpark inbox message type sent form homebase
and the group that it is sent to is 'everyone'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN all user will receive the message sent form homebase

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN there is a ballpark inbox message type sent from homebase
and the group that it is sent to is a specific group
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN only users part of that group will receive the message sent from homebase

*test by asking services to add your test users to a specific group

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a ballpark message type sent from homebase
and the message was sent with a sender and attachment image
and the message was sent without an action
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a sponsorship message will appear in Inbox
and the sender image will appear on the right in place of the default image
and the attachment will be in the message cell
and there will be an image displaying for the attachment
and tapping on the attachment does nothing

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a ballpark message type sent from homebase
and the message was sent with a sender and attachment image
and the message was sent with a body
and the user taps on the message
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will be taken to the message details view
and there will be the title of the message at the top
and below will be a larger version of the attachment image
and below the attachment image will be the body sent with the message

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a ballpark message type sent from homebase
and the message was sent without a sender image
and the message was sent with an attachment image
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN there when the message displays in inbox there will be a placeholder image for promo on the left
and there will be an attachment thumbnail for the attachment

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a ballpark message type sent from homebase
and the message was sent without a sender image
and the message was sent without an attachment image
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN there will be a placeholder image in place of the sender image
and there will be a placeholder image in place of the attachment image

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a ballpark message type sent from homebase
and there is an attachment sent with the message
and there is an action associated with that attachment
and the user taps on the attachment from the message cell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the action path that is associated with that attachment
example: URL, message details, or another view.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a ballpark message is sent from homebase
and there is an attachment sent
and the attachment has a title and body added to it
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN when the user looks at the attachment in the message cell he will see the title and body of the attachment displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user receives a message in inbox
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the date of the message will say 'just now'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user received a message an hour ago
and the message will display under the Today section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the received date will display 1 hr
and the message will appear under the Today section

*after 2 hours it will say 2 hr, etc

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has a message in inbox that is a day old
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the received date will display Month + date(Mar 2)
and the message will be displayed under the This Month section

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has a message that is from last month
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the received date for that message will display Month + date(Feb 23)
and it will display under the Last Month section

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user receives a message that is older than last month
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the message will display the date of the message
and it will display under a section where the title is that month name
Ex. January

title: User sees the Message Inbox button at the bottom menu tab of the app
custom_steps: WHEN a user is in the app
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the Message Inbox button located at the bottom menu tab of the app

title: User sees message icon and below it will say "No Messages"
custom_steps:
WHEN a user goes to inbox
AND the user has no messages
custom_expected: THEN the user will see a message icon and below, it will say "No Messages"

title: User sees a red badge w/ numerical value of unread messages right of the inbox icon
custom_steps: WHEN a user has unread messages in their message inbox
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red badge to the right of the inbox icon
AND a numerical value is shown indicating how many unread messages are in the user's message inbox

title: Message badge numerical value decreases by 1 as unread messages are read
custom_steps:
WHEN a user has 1 unread messages in their message inbox
AND the user opens message inbox
AND the user taps on the unread message
AND the user taps back to go back to the inbox
custom_expected:
THEN the message badge value will decrease by one (-1)
AND the numerical value will disappear from the button indicating that there are no unread messages left

title: Delete button appears as user swipe to the left on a message row AND is able to delete the message
custom_steps:
WHEN a user accesses message inbox
AND the user has a message(s) in an inbox
AND the user swipes to the left on one of the messages
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a delete button appear
AND tapping on that delete button will delete that message

title: Confirmation dialog is displayed confirming that user wants to delete a message
custom_steps:
WHEN a user opens a message from the inbox to go to the message details view
AND the user taps on the delete button
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive a dialog box asking user if he wants to delete that message
AND tapping on the "ok" button will delete that message

title: Message list refresh and display messages relevant to searched terms the user has entered
custom_steps: WHEN a user searches for a specific message in inbox
custom_expected: THEN the message list will refresh and should display the messages relevant to the search term that the user had entered

title: Inbox button is removed WHEN messageInboxKillSwitch = "true" in the app config
custom_steps: WHEN messageInboxKillSwitch is set to true in the app config
custom_expected:
THEN the inbox button will be removed from the app

*kill the app and relaunch to get the app config updated.

title: User can see new message in inbox from promo beacon AND has blue indicator meaning that it is unread
custom_steps: WHEN a user receives a notification from a promo beacon
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a new message in their message inbox for that promo
AND the message will have a blue indicator meaning that the message is unread

title: User can see a badge for unread messages in inbox with numerical value
custom_steps: WHEN a user has unread messages in their inbox(promo beacon, ballpark inbox message, ticket purchase confirmation, ticket accept message types)
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a badge to the right of the message inbox icon
AND the badge will show a numerical value
AND that value will be the number of unread messages currently in Inbox

title: WHEN user reads message THEN numerical value on badge decrease by 1
custom_steps: WHEN a user reads a message(promo beacon, ballpark inbox message, ticket purchase confirmation message types)
custom_expected: THEN the number displaying in the badge will decrease by 1 (-1).

title: WHEN user receives a new message THEN numerical value on badge increase by 1
custom_steps: WHEN a use receives a new message(promo beacon, ballpark inbox message, ticket purchase confirmation message types)
custom_expected: THEN the number displaying in the badge will increase by 1 (+1)

title: Blue indicator is removed once user gets notification from promo beacon AND the user views message from inbox
custom_steps:
WHEN a user receives a notification from a promo beacon
AND the user opens that message from inbox
custom_expected: THEN message inbox will mark the promo beacon message as read and remove the blue indicator

title: Upon receiving promo beacon message which includes URL, the user can tap "view details" button and is navigated to that URL (webview)
custom_steps:
WHEN a user receives a promo beacon message
AND the message includes a URL
custom_expected:
THEN the promo beacon message will have a "view details" button in the message details page
AND tapping on the "view details" button will open the url for that promo
AND tapping close on the webview will take the user back to the message

title: WHEN user is checked into a game, user will see unread check in confirmation message in their inbox with blue indicator
custom_steps: WHEN a user has checked into a game
custom_expected:
THEN a new message will appear in their inbox for the check-in confirmation
AND the message will be marked as unread 
AND there will be a blue indicator next to the message

title: User sees a check in message in inbox index
custom_steps: WHEN a user sees a checked in message in inbox index
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the checked in placeholder image appear on the left side of the message cell
AND the title will say "Checked in at" <ballpark name>
AND below the title will be the users season and overall check-in stats at that ballpark

title: WHEN a user has checked into a game, has checkin confirmation message and taps on that message
custom_steps:
WHEN a user has checked into a game
AND the user has a checkin confirmation message in inbox
AND the user taps on that message
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the message details for that particular check-in
AND there will be game details available in the message
AND below the game details will be your season and total check-in stats
AND there will be an image of the ballpark that the user has checked into
AND at the bottom of the page will be a View Details button

*Only will work for game type events (Exhibition, Regular Season, Postseason)

title: User will see a new message in inbox for check in offer and the message will be marked as unread
custom_steps:
WHEN a user has checked into a game
AND the user received an offer after checking in
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a new message in inbox for that check in offer
AND the message will be marked as unread

NOT FOR 5.0 RELEASE

title: After completing NTP the user receives message in inbox with blue indicator for that purchase AND the message is unread
custom_steps: WHEN a user has completed a native ticket purchase
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive a message in inbox for that purchase
AND the message will be marked as unread
AND there will be a blue indicator next to the message

title: After completing NTP WHEN user taps on the message, the message will be marked as read and blue indicator is removed
custom_steps:
WHEN a user has completed a native ticket purchase
AND the user taps on the message for that purchase in inbox
custom_expected:
THEN the message will be marked as read
AND the blue indicator will get removed

title: User views ticket confirmation message in inbox and see ticket placeholder image with title and order #
custom_steps: WHEN a user views a ticket confirmation message in inbox index
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a ticket placeholder image
AND the title of the message will be 'Ticket Purchase Confirmation'
AND there will be an Order # displayed

title: WHEN a user opens a ticket purchase confirmation message
custom_steps: WHEN a user opens a ticket purchase confirmation message
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the details view of the ticket purchase confirmation message user will see order number, confirmation email address, game details including teams, team logos, date, time, and ballpark name
AND below there will be the view tickets button

title: User is taken to the ticket list view of the event WHEN user opens ticket purchase confirmation message and taps view ticket button
custom_steps:
WHEN the user opens a ticket purchase confirmation message
AND the user taps on the view tickets button
custom_expected: THEN the user will be taken to the ticket list view of the event

title: User receives a ticket accept message WHEN user has accepted a ticket forward
custom_steps: WHEN a user has accepted a ticket forward
custom_expected: THEN the user will receive a ticket accept message in inbox

title: User views a ticket accepted message in inbox index
custom_steps: WHEN a user views a ticket accepted message in inbox index
custom_expected:
THEN the message will have a ticket placeholder image
AND the title will be Ticket Accepted
AND the body will say 'You have accepted x ticket or tickets from <sender's email address>

title: User views ticket accepted message
custom_steps: WHEN a user views a ticket accepted message
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the details view of the ticket purchase confirmation message
AND the user will see a ticket placeholder image at top
AND next to the placeholder image will be the title Ticket Purchase Confirmation
AND below it will be an image of the team the ticket was accepted for
AND below the image will be game details including teams, team logos, date, time, and ballpark name
AND below the game details will the body which will say 'You have accepted x ticket or tickets from <sender's email address>
AND below the body will be the view event button

title: WHEN a user taps on the view event button from the ticket accepted message
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the view event button from the ticket accepted message
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the ticket event details page of that game
AND the user will see the ticket or tickets he has for that game

title: WHEN a user searches for a message using the search bar
custom_steps: When a user searches for a message using the search bar
custom_expected:
THEN the search results will appear in the search view
AND tapping on the result will open that message

title: All user will receive the message sent form homebase
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a ballpark inbox message type sent form homebase
AND the group that it is sent to is 'everyone'
custom_expected: THEN all user will receive the message sent form homebase

title: Specific group of users receive the message sent from homebase
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a ballpark inbox message type sent from homebase
AND the group that it is sent to is a specific group
custom_expected:
THEN only users part of that group will receive the message sent from homebase

*test by asking services to add your test users to a specific group

title: User taps on ballpark message sent from homebase with sender and attachment image with body
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a ballpark message type sent from homebase
AND the message was sent with a sender and attachment image
AND the message was sent without an action
custom_expected:
THEN a sponsorship message will appear in Inbox
AND the sender image will appear on the right in place of the default image
AND the attachment will be in the message cell
AND there will be an image displaying for the attachment
AND tapping on the attachment does nothing

title: User taps on ballpark message sent from homebase without a sender image but with attachment image
custom_steps:
When there is a ballpark message type sent from homebase
AND the message was sent without a sender image
AND the message was sent with an attachment image
custom_expected:
THEN there when the message displays in inbox there will be a placeholder image for promo on the left
AND there will be an attachment thumbnail for the attachment

title: User gets ballpark message sent from homebase without sender image and attachment image
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a ballpark message type sent from homebase
AND the message was sent without a sender image
AND the message was sent without an attachment image
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a placeholder image in place of the sender image
AND there will be a placeholder image in place of the attachment image

title: User get a ballpark message sent from homebase with action associated attachment and user taps attachment from the message cell
custom_steps:
When there is a ballpark message type sent from homebase
AND there is an attachment sent with the message
AND there is an action associated with that attachment
AND the user taps on the attachment from the message cell
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the action path that is associated with that attachment
example: URL, message details, or another view.

title: User gets ballpark message sent from homebase with attachment sent that has title and body
custom_steps:
When a ballpark message is sent from homebase
AND there is an attachment sent
AND the attachment has a title and body added to it
custom_expected: THEN as the user looks at the attachment in the message cell he will see the title and body of the attachment displayed

title: User receives message in inbox and the date of the message will read "Just Now"
custom_steps: WHEN a user receives a message in inbox
custom_expected: THEN the date of the message will say "just now"

title: WHEN a user received a message an hour ago and the message will display under the Today section
custom_steps:
WHEN a user received a message an hour ago
AND the message will display under the Today section
custom_expected:
THEN the received date will display 1 hr
AND the message will appear under the Today section

*after 2 hours it will say 2 hr, etc

title: WHEN a user has a message in inbox that is a day old
custom_steps: WHEN a user has a message in inbox that is a day old
custom_expected:
THEN the received date will display Month + date(Mar 2)
AND the message will be displayed under the This Month section

title: WHEN a user has a message that is from last month
custom_steps: WHEN a user has a message that is from last month
custom_expected:
THEN the received date for that message will display Month + date(Feb 23)
AND it will display under the Last Month section

title: WHEN a user receives a message that is older than last month
custom_steps: WHEN a user receives a message that is older than last month
custom_expected:
THEN the message will display the date of the message
and it will display under a section where the title is that month name
Ex. January
